keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: In a ceremony at the Texas base, 47 people were awarded a Purple Heart or a Defense of Freedom Medal after a long fight over eligibility.

headline.print_headline: Ft. Hood Attack Victims Earn War Casualty Medals
headline.main: Fort Hood Shooting Victims Recognized as War Casualties

snippet: In a ceremony at the Texas base, 47 people were awarded a Purple Heart or a Defense of Freedom Medal after a long fight over eligibility.
abstract: Army recognizes victims of 2009 Fort Hood shooting as casualties of war, awarding 47 people either a Purple Heart or civilian equivalent, the Defense of Freedom Medal; gunman, Army psychiatrist Maj Nidal Hasan, was accused in 2011 Senate report of terrorism but Pentagon has long labeled the shootings a domestic criminal act, making victims ineligible for combat-related awards.
